div.class: inner col col24 first last id195fd546-566c-4045-9ad3-0ba2a5e86163
inner col col19 first last id87966b7c-94f3-4ca5-abde-e3c9db513a33

h4.a: City of Marietta Provides Information for Governor Kemp’s Plan to Reopen State

div.div: On April 20th Governor Kemp issued a statewide Executive Order which laid out plans to reopen the state for certain businesses. This Order takes precedent over local actions regulating how businesses operate during the Public Health State of Emergency. Read on...

h4.a: City of Marietta Awarded Special Allocation of Community Development Block Grant Funds

div.div: The City of Marietta is pleased to announce that it has been awarded a special allocation of Community Development Block Grant funds to be used to prevent, prepare for and respond to COVID-19. Read on...

h4.a: City of Marietta Provides Information for Statewide Shelter in Place Order

div.div: On Wednesday, April 8, 2020, Governor Brian Kemp updated his statewide Executive Order which included a shelter in place from 6pm on Friday, April 3, 2020 until 11:59pm on Thursday, April 30, 2020 to help mitigate the spread of COVID-19. Read on...

h4.a: WorkSource Cobb Provides Virtual Job Assistance

div.div: In response to economic impacts of COVID-19 on businesses and residents, WorkSource Cobb has launched a virtual talent recruitment and training assistance program. Read on...

h4.a: City of Marietta Declares Emergency Situation, Allows for Certain Alcohol Sales

div.div: The City has been notified by the Georgia Department of Revenue, the governing body of state alcohol licenses, that they have relaxed rules and regulations for the sale of unopened wine and beer during the Governor’s State of Emergency declaration. Read on...

h4.a: Business License Renewal Payments Delayed Until May 30th

div.div: As part of the Special Called City Council Meeting to make the declaration of an emergency situation, City Council voted to extend the due date for business license renewal payments from March 31st to May 30th. Read on...

h4.a: City of Marietta Declares Emergency Situation, Provides Resources for Small Businesses

div.div: On Tuesday, March 24th, City Council declared an emergency situation within the City of Marietta and enacted emergency measures to mitigate the spread of COVID-19 in conjunction with Governor Kemp’s Emergency Declaration and Federal Health Guidelines. Read on...

h4.a: Helpful City Hall Phone Numbers

div.div: City Hall is open for business, but in an effort to mitigate the potential for exposure to the Coronavirus we have put together a list of helpful contact numbers for City Hall Departments. Read on...

h4.a: Marietta Power & Water to Suspend Service Disconnects until May 11th

div.div: Marietta Power and Water is committed to providing reliable service to its customers. Due to the public health crisis, Marietta Power & Water will not disconnect residential or commercial customers for nonpayment from March 18 – May 11, 2020. Read on...

h4.a: City of Marietta's Permitting Process Completely Online & Paperless

div.div: Since April 2018, the City of Marietta has given residents and contractors the ability to process all permits on the City's website, thus never needing to come to City Hall to do business. Read on...

h4.a: City of Marietta Remains Open for Business

div.div: The City of Marietta will remain open and able to provide government services to all its residents in the midst of the COVID-19 situation. Read on...

h4.a: City Announces Glover Park Concert Series Schedule!

div.div: The City of Marietta and its Parks, Recreation and Facilities Department is pleased to announce the lineup for the 2020 Glover Park Concert Series on the Marietta Square! Read on...

h4.a: Marietta Museum of History Presents New Exhibit: Made by Her Hands

div.div: The Marietta Museum of History is proud to present Made by Her Hands: The Beauty, Warmth and Stories of Local Quilting. This special exhibit highlights quilts made locally in Cobb County and the women who made them. Read on...

h4.a: Call for Artists: 34th Annual Marietta Art in the Park Festival

div.div: Marietta Art in the Park, a Labor Day weekend tradition is looking for artists! Application deadine is May 22, 2020. Read on...

h4.a: Marietta Power Receives National Recognition for Reliable Electric Operations

div.div: The City of Marietta is pleased to announce that the city owned utility, Marietta Power, has received the Reliable Public Power Provider (RP3) award for 2020 from the American Public Power. Read on...

h4.a: City of Marietta Launches its Census Website to Help Engage Community

div.div: The City of Marietta is pleased to announce that it has launched its own website for the 2020 Census to help better engage the community and ensure a complete count of all the City’s residents. Read on...

h4.a: City of Marietta Adds More Features to Online Plan Review & Permit Application Process

div.div: The City of Marietta is pleased to announce that beginning Thursday, January 2, 2020 the City will add new features to its existing online permit process, SagesGov, which is already utilized by our customers. Read on...

h4.a: The Man with the Camera: Photographs by Raymond T. Burford

div.div: The Marietta Museum of History is proud to present The Man with the Camera: Photographs by Raymond T. Burford. This special exhibit highlights African American photographer Raymond T. Burford and the local black communities that he documented. Read on...
/CivicAlerts.aspx

inner col col24 first last idc7f5edd0-ea80-4f2c-a5c5-59b560692361

h4.a: City of Marietta's Permitting Process Completely Online & Paperless

div.div: Since April 2018, the City of Marietta has given residents and contractors the ability to process all permits on the City's website, thus never needing to come to City Hall to do business. Read on...

h4.a: City of Marietta Releases New Upgraded Version of MyMarietta App

div.div: The City of Marietta’s Information Technology Department is pleased to announce that it has released a new, upgraded version of its “MyMarietta” App which is now available for download on the App Store or Google Play. Read on...

h4.a: City of Marietta Releases New FREE “Trash Talk” App

div.div: The City of Marietta is pleased to release a new citizen friendly sanitation app called “Trash Talk” to better aide your trash and recycling needs! Read on...
/CivicAlerts.aspx
